info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 5:20AM EDT until May 28 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Hot Springs affecting Madison County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Hot Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet the French Broad River will begin exceeding its banks and flooding adjacent low-lying areas including farmland, woodland, and hiking trails. At 9.5 feet, Parts of Silver Mine Road and River Road may begin to flood. Areas near Spring Creek in the Hot Springs Spa area will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.2 feet and rising slowly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to near 8.5 feet by this afternoon then fall below Action/Advisory Stage overnight tonight. - Action/Advisory Stage is 7.5 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
